skillTree.localised_description: The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
His faith? That of those who will forever be considered the antagonist.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: The Khazag are driven onward by the ambition of their High Zar.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +15 for Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Enemy leadership: -15 for Warriors of Chaos, Beastmen, and Norsca
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: A warmace so devestating it is rumoured to be forged by some Chaos God.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Cunning and vile, yet useful enough to teach Thorgar valueable lessons of the arcane.

effects.description:
Recruit Rank: +4 for Shaman Sorcerers
	(local province)
Diplomatic relations: +10 with Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Beastmen and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: The chant can be heared from a long distance and strikes fear in the hearts of many a tribe.
The mutated beasts of the steppes provide iron like furs, useful for any warmongering tribe of marauders.
His bloodcry signals the ultimate frenzy as blood flows freely, the bludgeon howls in comfort.
Fed only with meat and starved before battle, the mammoths of the Khazag tribe perform unnaturally in battle.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +15 for Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Ability: "Frenzied Carnivore'' for Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
No mortal host shall hold them back.
The Hound's unearthly fury is personified by its Champions' thirst for war and hunger for unending blood and violence.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Unstable and miscreated, the Crow's strength spreads and grows like the most successful of diseases, consuming all before consuming itself and beginning again.
Although the youngest of the Dark Gods, the Serpent is no less potent and can bind mortals to eternal service with alluring visions or tantalising temptations.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: As the undisputed master of magic, the Eagle uses complex sorcery to influence its followers and draw opponents into his multifarious, interwoven schemes.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky – its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

skillTree.localised_description: No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +150
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

items.colour_text: The story how Thorgar managed to claim his title as Zar is too often told among the Khazags. As Thorgar challenged his father to a duel to the death. His flail, nicknamed the Khural's Bludgeon, wrapped around the old Zar's legs and with one powerful sweep Thorgar ended the life of his father. Thus claiming the title as Zhar of the Khazag. It was renamed Slayer of Kings accordingly.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

items.colour_text: This highly ornate suit of Chaos Armour shimmered with unnatural energies that distorted the position of the wearer so that an enemy's blows missed their mark, a gift bestowed by those who deemed Thorgar worthy of far more sinister yet greater things.
Gifted by Thorgar during his quest for Daemonic Ascension, the Ring is filled with the warping power of Chaos, the Ring of Change could transform an attacker into a slavering Chaos Spawn.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Chaos Spawn
Activates automatically when conditions are met

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The High Zar of the Khazag tribe chases his ultimate ambition.

effects.description: Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after winning a battle

Income from all buildings: +5% for each confederated Norscan tribe
	(local province)

ui_effects.localised_text: Increases this unit's ability to knock enemies back while active

stat_effects.description: x0.02 Dealt Collision Knocked Back Threshold
